intro: Androsace aizoon, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its dense rosette of hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in alpine gardens.
